news.title: Why the Lakers couldn't say no to Luka Dončić trade
news.description: In a shocking three-way trade between the Lakers, Mavericks, and Jazz, 25-year-old superstar Luka Dončić is headed to Los Angeles in exchange for Anthony Davis.
news.content:
We don't have all the answers just yet, but as we absorb the news of the NBA's blockbuster Lakers-Mavericks-Jazz three-way trade, we can look at the big picture and make some key takeaways. This is perhaps the most shocking trade in NBA annals, at least in my time circling the sun. Out of the blue, a 25-year-old superstar with time left to run on his contract has changed teams. I'm sure there's more backstory we're going to find out in the coming days, but right now, it looks like a massive risk for the Mavericks and an incredible stroke of fortune for the Lakers.

Per league sources, the terms are that Dončić, Markieff Morris and Maxi Kleber are going to the Lakers, and Anthony Davis and Max Christie are going to Dallas. Jalen Hood-Schifino goes to Utah along with a 2025 second-round pick from each team (the LA Clippers' 2025 pick is being sent from the Lakers; a complicated swap is being sent from Dallas, but it will ultimately result in it being Dallas' pick in 2025 unless the Washington Wizards win every game the rest of the season). Utah is sending back couch change (the minimum consideration of $110,000), split among Dallas and L.A., to legally complete the deal.

news.title: Trump administration finalizing plans to shutter Education Department
news.description: The Trump administration is finalizing plans to dismantle the Education Department through an executive order that would build on the president's campaign promise to hammer the longtime conservative target.
news.content:
The Trump administration is finalizing plans to dismantle the Education Department through an executive order that would build on the president's campaign promise to hammer the longtime conservative target.

The order — which President Donald Trump is expected to sign sometime this month, according to a White House official — was expected to lay out a two-part strategy for shuttering the agency, according to two people familiar with the plans and granted anonymity to discuss them.

It would direct the department to craft a plan to wind down its functions using its existing administrative authority. But the order was also expected to call for the agency to inventory a complex set of laws needed to delegate the department's powers to other agencies and then close the department, an acknowledgment that some of conservatives' biggest desires for change hinge on congressional approval. Such an order would launch a complex initiative. Some conservatives concede they currently lack enough support for legislation to close the department and farm its core functions out to other federal agencies.

While Trump has been vocal about closing the Education Department, the agency appears to have also drawn the attention of Elon Musk's government efficiency operation, which picked apart the US Agency for International Development over the weekend.

news.title: Arsenal, PSG and Bayern urged to end Visit Rwanda deals
news.description: The Democratic Republic of Congo has called on Arsenal, Bayern Munich and Paris St-Germain to end their 'blood stained' sponsorship deals with Visit Rwanda amid a worsening humanitarian crisis in the country.
news.content:
The Democratic Republic of Congo has called on Arsenal, Bayern Munich and Paris St-Germain to end their 'blood stained' sponsorship deals with Visit Rwanda amid a worsening humanitarian crisis in the country.

The appeal comes as M23 rebels captured Goma, the largest city in eastern DR Congo, while the United Nations' refugee agency estimates more than 400,000 people have been forced from their homes this year.

A group of UN experts maintains the Rwandan army is in 'de facto control of M23 operations'.

DR Congo's Foreign Minister Thérèse Kayikwamba Wagner has written to the owners of Arsenal and PSG and to Bayern president Herbert Hainer to 'question the morality' of the deals.

She highlighted how Visit Rwanda's sponsorship could be funded by the illicit mining of blood minerals in the occupied parts of DR Congo, before being transported across the border and exported from Rwanda.

news.title: China hits back at Trump tariff: 'Fentanyl is America's problem'
news.description: Beijing will challenge President Donald Trump's tariff at the World Trade Organization — a symbolic gesture — and take unspecified 'countermeasures' in response to the levy.
news.content:
BEIJING — China's government on Sunday denounced the Trump administration's imposition of a long-threatened 10% tariff on Chinese imports while leaving the door open for talks with the U.S. that could avoid a deepening conflict.

Beijing will challenge President Donald Trump's tariff at the World Trade Organization — a symbolic gesture — and take unspecified 'countermeasures' in response to the levy, which takes effect on Tuesday, China's finance and commerce ministries said.

That response stopped short of the immediate escalation that had marked China's trade showdown with Trump in his first term as president and repeated more measured language Beijing has used in recent weeks.

Trump on Saturday ordered 25% tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports and 10% on goods from China, saying Beijing needed to stanch the flow of fentanyl, a deadly opioid, into the United States. China's toned-down response marked a contrast with the direct retaliation and heated language from Canada, a long-time U.S. ally, and Mexico, the top destination for U.S. exports.

news.title: Palantir's Stock Surpasses $100
news.description: Palantir recommends its clients steer clear of Chinese startup DeepSeek's AI models as stock hits all-time high.
news.content:
Palantir recommends its clients steer clear of Chinese startup DeepSeek's AI models, a senior executive of the data analytics company said on Monday, days after doubts were raised about the United States' lead in AI technology.

'We would strongly discourage it (DeepSeek) and don't think any customer in the U.S. government will be able to use it,' Palantir's Chief Revenue Officer Ryan Taylor said.

U.S. officials are looking at the national security implications of the app DeepSeek, White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt said last week. Federal agencies such as NASA have also banned the use of the tech by employees, according to media reports.

The data analytics company also forecast first-quarter and annual revenue above Wall Street estimates on Monday. More than 40% of its fourth-quarter sales was from the U.S. government.

news.title: Elon Musk is serving as a 'special government employee,' White House says
news.description: Elon Musk is officially serving under President Donald Trump as a special government employee, according to a White House official.
news.content:
Elon Musk is officially serving under President Donald Trump as a special government employee, according to a White House official.

That designation means Musk – the billionaire tech entrepreneur who has been a force within the new Trump administration – is not a volunteer but also not a full-time federal employee.

According to a Justice Department summary, a special government employee is 'anyone who works, or is expected to work, for the government for 130 days or less in a 365-day period.' Musk is not being paid, a person familiar with his employment told CNN.

news.title: Rebels declare ceasefire in DR Congo for 'humanitarian reasons'
news.description: The alliance of rebel groups in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo have declared a humanitarian ceasefire starting on Tuesday.
news.content:
The alliance of rebel groups in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo have declared a humanitarian ceasefire starting on Tuesday.

In a statement, the group - which includes the Rwanda-backed M23 rebels - cited 'humanitarian reasons' for the ceasefire, after it has been capturing territory in eastern parts of the country.

The UN said at least 900 people have been killed and 2,880 injured in recent fighting in and around Goma, DR Congo's largest eastern city, after it was seized by rebels.

The G7 nations and the EU have condemned the offensive as a flagrant violation of DR Congo's sovereignty.

The alliance of rebel groups - known as the Congo River Alliance - has accused the Congolese military of killing people using aircrafts to bomb areas it holds.

It added it does not intend to seize any further territory, despite saying otherwise last week, and it will hold its positions.

news.title: Trump signs executive actions on Jan. 6, TikTok, immigration and more
news.description: President Trump on Monday signed a flurry of executive orders, reversing many of his predecessors' policies from his first term in office.
news.content:
President Donald Trump rescinded 78 Biden-era executive actions, executive orders, and presidential memoranda as part of a slew of more than 200 executive actions on the first night of his second presidency.

There were 42 executive orders and 115 personnel actions on Trump's "historic first day," White House officials said.

Trump began by rescinding nearly 80 Biden-era actions following remarks Monday evening at an inauguration celebration at Washington's Capital One Arena.

He then signed a regulatory freeze to prevent the issuance of any more federal regulations pending their review, and a freeze on all federal government hiring.

Trump signed a memo that requires all federal workers to return to in-person work, as well as a directive to every department and agency in the federal government to address the cost-of-living crisis.

He then signed a letter to be delivered to the United Nations indicating the United States' withdrawal from the Paris climate treaty.

He next signed an executive order intended to restore "freedom of speech" to federal employees and end what he called "federal censorship."

news.title: DeepSeek AI App Overtakes ChatGPT, Spooks Tech Market
news.description: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek becomes most downloaded free app in US, causing tech stocks to plunge.

related_news.title: China's DeepSeek AI dethrones ChatGPT on App Store: Here's what you should know
related_news.description: The buzz around Chinese AI startup DeepSeek began picking up steam earlier this month, when the startup released R1, its model that rivals...

related_news.title: Global tech shares fall as China AI chatbot DeepSeek spooks investors
What is Chinese AI startup DeepSeek?

news.content:
Chinese AI startup DeepSeek has taken the US app market by storm, becoming the most downloaded free app and sending shockwaves through the tech sector. The company's sudden rise has sparked concerns among investors about US tech companies' competitive edge in artificial intelligence.

DeepSeek's flagship app, which offers advanced AI capabilities including image generation and natural language processing, has garnered over 10 million downloads in just three days. The app's popularity has led to significant drops in the stock prices of major US tech companies, with some seeing declines of up to 8%.

Analysts point to DeepSeek's superior performance in certain AI tasks and its more permissive content policies as key factors driving its adoption. The company's R1 language model has demonstrated capabilities that some experts say exceed those of OpenAI's GPT-4.

However, the app's rapid rise has also raised security concerns among US officials, who are scrutinizing its data collection practices and potential ties to Chinese authorities. DeepSeek has maintained that it operates independently and adheres to strict data privacy standards.

news.title: Who will win IPL 2025? Betting odds and predictions for 2025 Indian Premier League season
news.description: As the 2025 IPL season approaches, defending champions Chennai Super Kings remain favorites, but Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bangalore show strong odds.
news.content:
As the Indian Premier League 2025 season draws near, betting markets and cricket analysts are weighing in on the potential champions. Defending champions Chennai Super Kings (CSK) lead the odds at 4.50, followed closely by Mumbai Indians at 5.00 and Royal Challengers Bangalore at 5.50.

CSK's strong position comes as no surprise given their consistent performance and strategic player retention. The MS Dhoni-led team has maintained their core group while adding key players in the auction, including emerging Australian talent Cameron Green.

Mumbai Indians have seen their odds improve following the acquisition of star all-rounder Hardik Pandya and the retention of captain Rohit Sharma. The five-time champions have also strengthened their bowling attack with several strategic picks.

Royal Challengers Bangalore, still in pursuit of their maiden title, have assembled what many consider their strongest squad yet. The Virat Kohli-led team has addressed their bowling concerns while maintaining their batting firepower.

Kolkata Knight Riders (6.00) and Delhi Capitals (6.50) round out the top five favorites. Rajasthan Royals, Punjab Kings, and Lucknow Super Giants are considered outside contenders with odds ranging from 7.00 to 8.50.

The tournament is set to begin on March 22, with defending champions CSK facing Royal Challengers Bangalore in the opening match at Chennai's MA Chidambaram Stadium.

news.title: Super Bowl 2025: Chiefs take questions on opening night in New Orleans
news.description: Players and coaches from both the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles took center stage at the Super Bowl's opening night in New Orleans, answering questions from reporters ahead of Sunday's big game.
news.content:
Super Bowl 2025 kicked off almost a week before the big game with its opening night in New Orleans. Players and coaches from both the Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles had the opportunity to answer questions from reporters ahead of Sunday's game.

The evening's events began at 8 p.m. EST at the Superdome, with the Eagles taking the stage first. Both teams then appeared together for a historic handshake moment before the Chiefs took their turn at 10 p.m.

The night was filled with memorable moments, including Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts fielding questions about his signature 'tush push' play, Chiefs head coach Andy Reid making a fashion statement in a Hawaiian shirt adorned with flamingos, and an amusing moment when Saquon Barkley was asked about his favorite color.

The opening night festivities were broadcast live on NFL Network, giving fans across the country a chance to see their favorite players and coaches in a more relaxed setting before the intensity of game day.

news.title: Chiefs Defeat Bills 32-29 in AFC Championship
news.description: Kansas City Chiefs advance to Super Bowl LIX after defeating Buffalo Bills, maintaining their shot at historic third consecutive title. Set to face Philadelphia Eagles on February 9 in New Orleans.
news.content:
In a thrilling AFC Championship game that came down to the wire, the Kansas City Chiefs emerged victorious over the Buffalo Bills with a score of 32-29. The win secures the Chiefs' spot in Super Bowl LIX, where they'll face the Philadelphia Eagles.

Patrick Mahomes led the Chiefs with 328 passing yards and three touchdowns, while Travis Kelce caught eight passes for 112 yards and two scores. The Bills' Josh Allen threw for 295 yards and ran for two touchdowns in the losing effort.

The game featured multiple lead changes and dramatic moments, including a crucial fourth-quarter drive by the Chiefs that consumed over seven minutes of clock time. Harrison Butker sealed the victory with a 45-yard field goal with just 22 seconds remaining.

This victory puts the Chiefs in position to become the first team in NFL history to win three consecutive Super Bowls. They'll face the Eagles in New Orleans on February 9th in what promises to be a historic matchup.

news.title: Hundreds of US visa appointments canceled in Colombia
news.description: Visa appointments at the U.S. Embassy in Colombia were canceled Monday following a dispute between President Donald Trump and his Colombian counterpart Gustavo Petro over deportation flights from the U.S. that nearly turned into a costly trade war between the two countries.
news.content:
The U.S. Embassy in Colombia has canceled hundreds of visa appointments following a diplomatic dispute between the two nations over deportation policies. The cancellations came after Colombian President Gustavo Petro threatened to refuse U.S. deportation flights carrying Colombian nationals.

The dispute began when President Trump announced plans to increase deportation flights to Colombia as part of his broader immigration enforcement strategy. President Petro responded by threatening to refuse landing rights for these flights, citing concerns about the treatment of Colombian citizens in U.S. detention facilities.

The situation escalated when both countries threatened trade restrictions, potentially affecting billions of dollars in bilateral trade. The U.S. State Department described the visa cancellations as a 'temporary measure' while diplomatic channels work to resolve the situation.

The cancellations have affected both tourist and business visa appointments, causing significant disruption for Colombian citizens planning travel to the United States. Local business leaders have expressed concern about the impact on commercial relations between the two countries.

news.title: Bill Gates admits 'foolish' mistake that led to divorce from Melinda
news.description: Bill Gates has openly admitted that his past connection with Jeffrey Epstein, the convicted sex offender, was a major error in judgment.
news.content:
Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates has publicly acknowledged that his association with Jeffrey Epstein was a significant factor in his divorce from Melinda French Gates, calling it a 'foolish mistake' in a recent interview.

Gates revealed that his meetings with Epstein, which occurred several times between 2011 and 2019, were aimed at discussing philanthropic opportunities. However, he now admits that these interactions showed poor judgment and contributed to the breakdown of his 27-year marriage.

'I made a mistake in judgment in thinking those discussions would go to global health,' Gates stated. 'That money never appeared. And I shouldn't have given him the credibility of being there.'

Melinda French Gates had previously expressed her disapproval of the relationship, describing Epstein as 'evil personified' in a 2021 interview. The couple announced their divorce in May 2021, ending one of the world's most prominent philanthropic partnerships.

news.title: Mike Tyson is bigger than boxing. His fight with Jake Paul is proof.
news.content:
Mike Tyson's upcoming fight with Jake Paul has transcended traditional boxing boundaries, becoming a cultural phenomenon that highlights Tyson's enduring impact on sports and entertainment.

The 57-year-old former heavyweight champion will face the 27-year-old YouTuber-turned-boxer on July 20 at AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. The event has already generated unprecedented interest, with preliminary pay-per-view projections exceeding 2 million buys.

Despite criticism from boxing purists who view the match as a publicity stunt, the fight has captured mainstream attention. Tyson's training videos have gone viral, showing glimpses of the power and speed that made him the youngest heavyweight champion in history.

The event will be streamed exclusively on Netflix, marking the streaming giant's first venture into live boxing. Industry experts suggest this could revolutionize how combat sports are broadcast and consumed.

news.title: Trump's family circle has a different look as he returns to the White House
news.content:
As Donald Trump returns to the White House, his inner circle reflects significant changes from his first term, with several family members taking reduced roles in his administration.

Notably absent are Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner, who served as senior advisers during his first term but have publicly stated their intention to remain in the private sector. The couple's decision marks a departure from the family-centric approach that characterized Trump's previous presidency.

Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump will continue managing the Trump Organization, maintaining separation between the family business and the administration. Melania Trump has indicated she will take a more traditional role as First Lady, focusing on specific initiatives rather than day-to-day policy matters.

The restructured family dynamic reflects lessons learned from Trump's first term and responds to criticism about nepotism in his previous administration.

news.title: The NBA is reportedly considering dropping the All-Star Game for a four-team tournament
news.content:
The NBA is considering a major overhaul of its All-Star weekend format, potentially replacing the traditional All-Star Game with an innovative four-team tournament. The proposed change could take effect as early as the 2025-26 season.

Under the new format, 48 top players would be divided into four teams, competing in a single-elimination tournament with significant prize money at stake. Each game would be played with heightened competitive intensity, addressing long-standing criticism about the lack of defense and effort in traditional All-Star Games.

The tournament would feature 10-minute quarters and other rule modifications designed to increase pace and scoring. Teams would be selected through a combination of fan voting and a draft system similar to the current format.

League officials believe this change could reinvigorate interest in the mid-season showcase, which has seen declining viewership in recent years.

news.title: Amazon's Zoox Plans To Launch Robotaxi Service This Year
news.content:
Amazon's autonomous vehicle company Zoox has announced plans to launch its robotaxi service in Las Vegas by the end of 2024, marking a significant milestone in the commercialization of self-driving technology.

The company's purpose-built electric vehicles, which feature bidirectional driving capabilities and no steering wheel, have completed extensive testing on public roads. Initial service will be limited to specific routes in Las Vegas, with plans for gradual expansion to other cities.

Zoox's vehicles can accommodate four passengers and operate at speeds up to 75 mph. The company has emphasized its focus on safety, with each vehicle equipped with more than 100 safety innovations not found in conventional cars.

The launch represents a major step forward in Amazon's autonomous vehicle strategy and could position the company as a leader in the emerging robotaxi market, which is projected to reach $2.5 trillion by 2040.

news.title: Travis Kelce Doubles Down on His Swiftie Status
news.content:
Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce has embraced his connection to Taylor Swift's fanbase, openly discussing his appreciation for her music and the positive impact she's had on NFL viewership.

In a recent podcast appearance, Kelce shared his favorite Swift songs and discussed attending multiple Eras Tour concerts. He praised Swift's songwriting abilities and performance skills, noting how her presence at Chiefs games has brought new fans to football.

'The way she's brought her fanbase into the NFL world has been incredible to watch,' Kelce said. 'It's been fun seeing two different fan cultures come together.'

The NFL has reported significant increases in female viewership and merchandise sales since Swift began attending Chiefs games. Kelce's jersey sales have reportedly increased by over 400% since their relationship became public.
